challenge.title: Task 85
challenge.description:
When you say You're right to think this way, you mean that the other person's way of thinking about something is correct or reasonable. For example, if you think a task will be hard and someone says, You're right to think this way, they agree that the task is indeed hard and understand why you think so.

In this context, anyway is used to show that you are grateful for something despite any difficulties or problems. For example, if someone tried to help you even though it was hard for them, you might say, Thanks, anyway, to show you appreciate their effort even if things didn't turn out perfectly.

question.text: What can we conclude based on Maria's answer?

answers.answer: She thought it was best to save money, so they went with only 3 trays of salad
answers.feedback: The decision was not related to saving money.

answers.answer: She thought Bob's double checking was unnecessary
answers.feedback: Not really. She said he was right to double check.

answers.answer: She liked that Bob double checked the amount of food
She thought Bob picked the right choices of menu for the party
answers.feedback: Her comment was not related to picking choices, but to his decision of double checking the food.

dialogue.text: I just wanted to make sure everyone has enough choices.
And you're totally right to think this way. Thanks for double checking anyway.
